amendment.description: To provide Taiwan with critically needed United States-built multirole fighter aircraft to strengthen its self-defense capability against the increasing military threat from China.

vote.text: Amendment SA 634, under the order of 9/21/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 48. Record Vote Number: 148.

action.text: Amendment SA 634 proposed by Senator Cornyn. (consideration: CR S5853-5857, S5860-5866, S5879-5881; text: CR S5853-5854) To provide Taiwan with critically needed United States-built multirole fighter aircraft to strengthen its self-defense capability against the increasing military threat from China.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 634, under the order of 9/21/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 48. Record Vote Number: 148.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 634 proposed by Senator Cornyn.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 634, under the order of 9/21/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 48. Record Vote Number: 148.
